The '''Fell beasts''',<ref name=V6>{{RK
column4: 100}}</ref> were the flying creatures on which the [[Nazgûl]] rode after being unhorsed at the [[Ford of Bruinen]].

column1: ==History==

The fell beasts were winged creatures with beak and claws, similar to birds but much larger than any other flying beast. The creature possessed a naked body without feathers, a long neck, and a vast hide between its horned fingers. Furthermore, the body of the creature gave off a stench.<ref name=V6/>
{{Blockquote
column2: [...] it was a winged creature: if bird, then greater than all other birds, and it was naked, and neither quill nor feather did it bear, and its vast pinions were as webs of hide between horned fingers; and it stank. A creature of an older world maybe it was [...]

column1: While the exact origin of the beasts is unknown, they were likely bred by Sauron from a creature of the [[Elder Days]] to supply the Nazgûl with steeds.<ref name=V6/>

On the River [[Anduin]] near [[Sarn Gebir]], [[Legolas]] might have shot one down in the night as it approached the [[Fellowship of the Ring]], although the identity of the creature he shot remains unknown.<ref>{{FR

During the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]], the [[Witch-king]] of [[Angmar]], the Lord of the Nazgûl, rode his fell beast in battle against King [[Théoden]] of [[Rohan]]. The Lord of the Nazgûl, riding the evil beast, shot a dart which killed [[Snowmane]], Théoden's horse (which fell on Théoden, crushing him). Dernhelm (who revealed herself as [[Éowyn]]) defended the dying Théoden, challenging and killing the beast.<ref name=V6/>
